" he currently head centre european reform , this slim volume he attempting european union what he great britain . leonard reminds us european union not superstate , nor it federation or empire . it more like decentralized network . he compares eu visa , company whose logo appears half billion credit cards employs only 3,000 people . visa actually owned 21,000 financial institutions use it . eu , like visa , basically enabling institution rather than overbearing bureaucracy . attraction european union its members or potential members its transformational power . it not threaten military power , instead threat excluded world largest single market its most potent weapon . become member , country must transform itself within comply 80,000 plus pages law written brussels - laws cover everything human rights product development . critics say this superstate , undemocratic one . leonard disagrees this characterization . not only eu rationalized commercial policies provided common currency , it given small medium-sized countries voice increasingly globalized world . under aegis eu all member countries say international negotiations . likewise , leonard claims important internal issues such taxes , pensions , healthcare , education , europeans still make decisions level nation state . but what recent rejection france netherlands eu constitution ? no big deal , says leonard . europe always crisis it always debating its future identity , it just day office . one lessons learned this rejection , however , eu require more debate more democracy future . example , any future expansion eu there referendum . if turkey or balkan states want join , they not only meet all legal human rights requirements , they also accepted voters member countries . they famously say , there deepening before there widening . optimist booster eu , leonard dismissive numerous long-term problems lie ahead . europe overgenerous welfare system become even more burdensome its population ages declines . we seen recently , many european cities large pockets unassimilated immigrants whose numbers increasing rapidly . moreover , high taxation high regulation stifle business formation expansion . he glosses over these issues , leonard exudes confidence european model law negotiaton find way solve these problems . this excellent book familiarize oneself european worldview , it worldview sharply different those who still live hobbsian world power politics	1

tropic cancer henry miller . not recommended . his 1960 introduction tropic cancer , karl shapiro said , " i call henry miller greatest living author because i think he , " " . . . spiritual example he stands among great men our age , " " . . . he [ orwell ] predicts miller set pace attitude novelist future . this not happened yet , but i agree it must . " shapiro not support any these points his essay , nothing tropic cancer supports them , either . tropic cancer consists 318 pages recounting miller experience american expatriate paris expounding his personal philosophy , often ways rambling painfully nonsensical . miller stories his friends tedious , pointless , catty ; like miller , they seem talentless hacks whose belief their own artistic abilities makes them artists writers , though believing . miller writes , " year ago , six months ago , i thought i artist . i no longer think it , i am " -- which type arrogant pretentiousness he mocks virtually all his acquaintances . when they not creating , or talking philosophy or creating , miller his circle seem spend nearly every moment picking up women ( disease ) . they rarely use neutral term such " woman " when there so many obscene , demeaning words which objectify gender . women miller friends find invariably portrayed stupid , drunken , irrational , loose , sly , deceptive , good primarily one function , which miller turns into squalid , cold , joyless act . spite all vice " living , " no one seems fun , some characters , notably fillmore , find themselves nearly trapped into bourgeoisie life . miller expresses contempt machine , industrial age , money -- although he schemes keep 2,800 francs fillmore mistress revels so much his pocket . often hungry , miller obsesses food relies his friends support him . when he describes his indian friend kepi " . . . scrounger , sort human tick who fastens himself hide even poorest compatriot , " he could talking himself he bitterly complains those his friends who stingy money , accommodations , food , wine . miller logic working world facile ; he writes , " if you want bread , you've got get harness , get lockstep . " surface , this true , but it never seems occur him , if you want bread , someone must cultivate , raise , harvest wheat produce other components ; someone must transform these components into bread ; someone must deliver it shops cafes . other words , if most people weren't " lock step , " miller could choose starve or set himself produce bread , joining world harness . he makes his choice clear , then whines it . he may despise those who support him , whether they friends or workers , but perhaps because he , misanthrope who finds fault everyone but himself , needs very people he denigrates ( including " grocer , baker , shoemaker , butcher , etc . -- all imbecilic-looking clodhoppers " ) , reliance which he resents . he hates machine machine mind , but offers no alternatives . seemingly incapable sincere feeling , miller finds human emotion amusing . when friend says , " boy break your heart . . . he so damned beautiful ! so cruel ! " miller writes , " we laugh this . it sounded preposterous . but collins earnest . " when acquaintance whom he owes money dies , he writes , " any rate , he killed automobile accident shortly after my arrival , circumstance which left me twenty-three francs good . " shapiro claims miller poet , but his attempts poetic philosophic ramblings often make little if any sense . speaking buildings statues , miller says , " . . . they must saturated my anguish , " kind bad metaphor which he frequently indulges . he describes artists such himself " inhuman ones . " " i am inhuman ! i say it mad , hallucinated grin , i keep saying it though it rain crocodiles . behind my words all those grinning , leering , skulking skulls , some dead grinning long time , some grinning if they lockjaw , some grinning grimace grin , foretaste aftermath what always going . " whenever these attempts poetic philosophy appeared , rambling pages , i found myself yearning return his insipid stories prostitutes , disease , friends , hunger . tropic cancer perhaps worst book i ever read ( i promise myself i would read tropic capricorn ) . shapiro says , " there not many these emancipated beings left our world [ emancipated what ? -- dls ] , these clowns clairvoyants , celebrants soul flesh still-remaining promise america . " if miller , his whining , his criticism , his holier-than-everyone attitude , his " art , " his two-dimensional view people , his obsession excrement , " greatest " these souls , may i never meet least . note : if there 0 stars option , tropic cancer would earned it	-1

" oral history " begins osama early days . his father very , very anti-israel . he educated good school , very polite ( attribute maintained into adulthood ) , but not stand-out student . osama also quite religious , even his youth . rather than inheriting $200-$300 million fortune , bergen believes more credible figure around $20 million ( there 53 siblings which share ) . 1979 soviet invasion afghanistan shocked bin laden , thousands other devout young muslims - it first time since wwii non-muslim power invaded muslim country . bin laden involvement began donor , then holy warrior . most who knew his military involvement scornful , seeing he no military skills probably simply creating martyrs . further , bergen concludes osama impact very limited - number afghans fighting soviets varied 175-250 , 000 , while number arabs involved any point no more than few hundred , split several groups . thus , " real " outcome determined afghans themselves , together aid provided $3 billion u.s. aid ( no evidence any it went afghan arabs ) , additional support saudi arabia . bin laden victory vs . russians jaji ' 87 only p.r. accomplishment involving 50-60 arabs ( including bin laden ) over 22 day period . osama also spent six months building road through tora bora mountains ' 87 ( jaji jalalabad ) , gaining familiarity undoubtedly benefited when u.s. invaded 2001 . ayman al zawahiri , bin laden chief deputy , radicalized three years ' imprisonment torture egypt , part reaction sadat assassination ( not involved ) . he got osama focus not only afghan jihad , but also regime change arab world ( ousting repressive secular regimes , which also supported u . . ) . after soviets left afghanistan ' 89 country slipped into civil war - first drive out communist regime left behind , then various afghan factions . osama washed his hands area moved sudan . while there osama journeyed back saudi arabia made speeches against both u.s. ( its support moving one million russian jews israel ) saddam hussein . he even volunteered services his afghan arab veterans , plus new recruits , repel hussein kuwait - turned down preference more americans " last straw " osama - he turned against saudi royal family , ultimately his citizenship revoked . drug monies offered support osama efforts - he declined , not wanting " profit " blood innocent people . this point osama four wives - three university lecturers spinsters whom he married support islamic principles . osama opposed ' 92 landing 28,000 americans somalia food relief , seeing it part larger american strategy take over islamic world . same time , ramzi yousef masterminded ' 93 wtc bombing - he trained al qaeda camp . bomb itself cost $ 20,000 ; rationale u.s. support israel . osama repeatedly challenged actions killed children other innocents . his response reference u.s. atomic bombing nagasaki hiroshima , well purported loss one million iraqi children due u . . -supported sanctions . bergen also reports prior 9/11 afghan used gofer both osama british cameraman wanted help tell u.s. al qaeda planning hijack jets u.s. secure release " blind sheikh " held wtc bombing . fbi ended up both delaying his movement thailand meeting him - until after 9/11 . bergen states bin laden not involved 9/11 details ( nor those cole , etc . bombings ) . nonetheless , he ultimate commander , knew plans , supported effort . bergen also believes bin laden made serious error projecting u.s. reaction - he hoped , based prior u.s. actions eg . lebanon , u.s. would withdraw middle east , or invade afghanistan become bogged down protracted guerrilla war . instead , u.s. used 300 special forces troops ground , massive airpower , northern alliance forces quickly defeat al qaeda . " osama ... i know " also presents credible information knowledgeable sources refute rumor osama suffers form acute kidney disease - just low blood pressure foot wound incurred fighting soviets . bergen rather critical u.s. vs . osama escape afghanistan . sources clearly place bin laden there ( including bin laden himself ) only 300 others - yet he got away . bergen claims there more american journalists scene than u.s. soldiers . " acquiring nuclear chemical weapons religious duty " - osama , ' 99 . bergen sources , however , doubtful than osama any success acquiring nuclear capability , though he apparently scammed effort . osama opposed efforts foment civil war shia sunni , reports bergen ; meanwhile , zarqawi not join al qaeda until ' 04 - two years after sec . powell claimed iraq harboring zarqawi major al qaeda figure his effort justify invading iraq . bergen sees greater danger future iraq " foreign fighters " after iraq struggle than their afghan counterparts . rationale - their experience fighting stronger u.s. army focus urban strategies ( ieds suicide bombers ) . bergen also makes strong criticism u.s. intelligence efforts . he notes there over 30 audio videotapes bin laden his chief deputy post 9/11 , one guaranteed method finding them tracing back their chain custody . even knowing tape would likely delivered al jazeera pakistan bureau prior 2004 election u.s. failed stake out scene . thus , our $30+ billion proven totally inadequate . finally , bergen also quite critical bin laden strategies-to-date , noting his efforts remake muslim world not succeeded - u.s. more involved than ever . further , taliban ahs destroyed . bergen believes without u.s. invasion iraq fragmented islam militant movement would imploded year or so post 9/11 . bottom line : al qaeda no attractive vision world it seeks create - best it associated creating taliban-like control over other muslims	1

jonathan kozol savage inequalities one best books ever published illustrates dual nature american public education system how unfair system . book looks poor urban schools six different areas u.s. displaying challenges teachers , administrators , most importantly students those schools face each day . kozol points out book how even though public education probably isn't social panacea so many promised it , it something we require all children therefore , we should provide all children best possible education equal across board . book also displays many inequalities exist our public education system based upon racist public policies controlled local state governments ( which now supported federal government ) . problem ginormous -- but it addressed . we gamble children our nation own future each time we ignore problem . recent years , savage inequalities critized it accurate portrayal , but offering no solution . those who hold view fail recognize kozol intent writing this book . most people today no idea situation public schools so bad , let alone 1990 when savage inequalities first published . book caused controversy schools around country its brutal examination led small handful schools pass major reforms . however , most , if not all problems kozol raised still not adequately addressed . things east st. louis improved somewhat , but kids there still shortchanged . chicago public school system reformed tightened their teaching requirements , but unequal funding still exists new york city public school system hasn't seen any changes -- kids still go school windowless roller skate rink there . i went back school get my teaching certification only live 50 miles east st. louis i no idea things bad they . savage inequalities opened my eyes i'll never same . it one those rare books change your outlook forever , especially someone going into education	1

" they're still hot trail miles delacourt monstrous " future king " england . meanwhile , mr. six strives help his teammates remember they're actually undercover invisibles agents . addition this , six helga attempt deprogram sir miles . while this going , jack frost africa jolly roger , where he comes closer realizing his buddhahood . king mob mostly out picture , off meditating india , trying rid himself need kill . after laying rest 99 year-old invisible edith , king mob et al reunite final showdown miles delacourt demonic archons he serves . this culminates satanic crowning monstrous king august 11 , 1999 , horrific ceremony which entails butchering children homeless victims . instead action scene volume 2 , events play out more lines mystical denouement volume 1 , jack frost once again proving he most powerful human alive . above two paragraphs make events volume 3 sound rather simplistic . this not case . i mentioned , since this final volume series , one might expect morrison answer questions . instead , he chooses make volume 3 opaque difficult possible . even dialog doesn't help sort things out ; characters don't talk each other , they trade " i'm too cool " banter . what makes this all more grating morrison so obviously taken his themes plots works robert anton wilson terrence mckenna ; but unlike those authors , who always guide reader through their labyrinthine visions , morrison instead tosses everything into blender hopes it all comes out " cool . " therefore , chance any emotional impact pretty much lost . volume 3 saved final story series , " glitterdammerung . " fully illustrated frank quitely , this possibly single best issue invisibles . previous 11 issues volume 3 wrapped up series storyline , but it up " glitterdammerung " explain what series itself all . set 2012 , story operates more metaphysical look back series than linear tale . it tie up several subplots , also ends series defiantly anarchic note , jack frost frees himself confines comic itself . this story alone gives book 7 4-star rating . secret revealed book 7 this ( avoid this paragraph if you hate spoilers , though if you know this , it probably wouldn't " spoil " anything , anyway ! ) : invisibles game , one played someone ( john a'dreams ? jack frost ? you ? ) . toward very end series , several characters begin figure this out , most notably john a'dreams , white-suited former invisible who disappeared before events book 1 : " say you want revolution . " its really impossible any one guide " end-all " guide . notable unique feature third ear guide many pages great biographies famous musicians instrument back ( pianists , violinists , violists , cellists , wind players , percussionists , vocalists etc ) . so , here you find legends rubinstein , horowitz , pires , perahia , grumiaux , oistrakh , casels , starker , bain , holliger , graham , pavoratti many other admired musicians/vocalists thoughout past century . addition some curious history career milestones these well-loved performers , third ear guide also cites some their better recordings - real valuable feature i found . however , this guide waxes hot cold depending composer/genre . example , listings available performances huge category like beethoven 32 piano sonatas , there several entire pages covering nearly two dozen musicians who recorded those works compelling insights into their styles , historic performances careers . really great stuff conoisseur ! but , other categories it different story . most frustrating some many cases , obvious top recordings major performers not mentioned , leaving reader incomplete information . but , bottom line no one guide end-all resource , serious collectors this guide gramophone penguin guides each really something valuable often unique contribute study finest recordings . style side , commentary not dry academic but full human interest spicy opinions - revealing " nuggets " fascinating information music you most love . additionally , editors not always prim-and-proper , saying only positive things ( like penguin guide ) but actually give critical insightful comments which truly helps one sort out pack . this respect , third ear guide probably most interesting read compared others . so , this guide much more than just guide look up ratings - it fascinating journey into classical music , its vast repertoire its performers . if you serious collector , multiple guides area always best way go get wide variety opinion . if you really only pick one guide , most people would go legendary penguin guide . but , my second guide would definately third ear ( over gramophone ) it often lists recordings suprisingly not listed penguin . also , it just plain fun fascinating read random	1

kokoro natsume soseki spans vast pacific ocean serves priceless gateway japanese literature culture . centered around universal theme loneliness modern world , this masterpiece belongs all libraries . this quiet , psychological novel sparse dialogue portrays sensei , reserved , intellectual , introspective mentor . while sometimes criticized distant characters , edwin mcclellan perfectly translated subtle japanese writing style aimed ethereal . divided into three sections , kokoro greatly differs western classics style . structure seamlessly blends self-contained notions presented blocky style , creating rich harmony unlike anything found western literature . exceptionally quotable book , every page contained multiple , profound statements all aspects life . written early 20th century , this timeless work exudes almost prophetic feel perhaps even more applicable today than 1914 . sensei stated , " i believe words uttered passion contain greater living truth than those words which express thoughts rationally conceived , " every word kokoro uttered utmost passion .	1

ai love you ( 1994 . ) manga series ken akamatsu . introduction : one hottest names japanese manga comic titles ken akamatsu . series like love hina negima his name , his popularity ranks among top japan many manga writers . but , there time when akamatsu wasn't so popular . time when he still up-and-coming artist trying make name himself . during era time which he released ai love you , series would first expose world him . many ways it seen his first major triumph ! read , see how ai love you measures up ! overview ( information ): ken akamatsu first released ai love you series 1994 . volumes originally smaller , broken-down stores featured japanese manga showcase periodicals . this american edition first released 2004 , roughly decade after japanese debut , new edition features bonus material - character sketches , interviews akamatsu , more . overview ( storyline ): ai love you follows story young man high school . he total loser , unable anything well . sports , school work , social life - this guy fails every area . except one - computer programming . using artificial intelligence program , he created perfect girl . she just pigment his imagination inside his computer - until freak accident during storm brought her out his computer into real world ! now loser nobody liked best-looking girl around his side .... but it not great it seems ! artificial intelligence , she lacks several common sense traits people . because this she always unintentionally screws things up or hurts people . but her creator stands her all way , trying make her into ideal girl he always dreamed . if he didn't enough issues his hands already .... review ( story ): wow . i never would guessed ken akamatsu would story out this good prior his magnum opus love hina ! how wrong i . this not only excellent story its own right , it also seems like premonition his later work many ways . instance , main character here very similar keitaro , male protagonist love hina . his two male friends also similar keitaro two male friends series . there bunch other little similarities , too . art style fairly primitive compared his later works , yet it still looks great . storyline instantly going sound familiar anyone who seen film weird science , but this no rip-off film any means ! plenty interesting plot lines , drama , romance , humor alike , it awesome series all its own . akamatsu also makes smart move not introducing too many characters once - mistake he'd making way too often his later works ( negima comes mind . ) likewise , this point he wasn't using same plot lines over over again , making this one his most unique interesting works . this one best manga titles i read long time . it definitely gets my highest recommendation . review ( edition ): these tenth anniversary reissues ai love you give reader more than just story . much like reissues love hina , you get bonus content ! bonuses include interviews akamatsu , early/rough sketches many characters , plenty other little things here there . there also usual ads other manga series . great series , these bonus features make deal even sweeter . overall : this series exceeded my expectations . i expecting rough , underdeveloped half-assed take love hina - but i got something blew my mind ! this easily one best manga titles out there , it unfortunate it not among more popular works akamatsu created over years . if you're fan manga , you want little bit everything , ai love you you . highly recommended ! edition notes : this manga series reissued 2004 bonus content mentioned above . those versions readily available america , any bookstore or manga retailer should plenty them stock .	1

' roughing it'is twain decription his adventures nevada , califonia , sandwich islands originally published ( 1872 ) . after immediate success publication ' innocents abroad'which firmly established twain reputation writer he spurned american publishing company bring out volume based his experiences wes t.t hus , ' roughing it ' created . highly entertaining humurous narrative his escapades western united states towards end 19th century . little taste : ( copyright 1979 running press)this before after descriptions company men lost snow storm-with little or no hope survival . before ( impending doom ) " ... poor ollendorff broke down tears came . he not alone , i crying too , so mr. ballou . ollendorff forgave me thingsi said . then he got out his bottle whisky said whether he lived or died he would never touch drop . he said he given up all hope life , although ill-prepared , ready submit humbly his fate ----------- mr. ballou made remarks similar purport , began reform he could not live continue , throwing away his ancient pack cards -------- my own remarks same tenor those my comrades . we all sincere , all deeply moved earnest , we precense death without hope . i threw away my pipe , doing it , i felt last i free hated vice one ridden me like tyrant all my life . we put our arms around each other necks awaited warning drowziness occurs death freezing . after-(alive well)after breakfast we felt better , zest life soon came back . world looked bright again , existence dear us ever . presently uneasiness came over me-grew upon me-assailed me without ceasing . alas , my regeneration not complete-i wanted smoke ! i resisted all my strength , but flesh weak . i wandered away alone wrestled myself hour . i recalled my promises reform preached myself persuasively , unbraidingly , exaustively . but all vain , i shortly found myself sneaking amoung snowdrifts hunting my pipe . i discovered it after considerable search , crept away hide myself enjoy it . last i lit my pipe , no human feel meaner baser than i then . i ashamed my own pitiful company . still dreading discovery , i felt perhaps further side barn would somewhat safer , so i turned corner . i turned corner , smoking , ollendorff turned other his bottle his lips , us sat unconscious ballou deep game " solitaire " old greasy cards ... " turn chapters 22 23 more cohesive description this comic episode . laughter good medicine , this fun read one those gloomy days you might encounter your way . enjoy . good health !	1

major criticism this book omission any discussion john maynard keynes unique highly original contributions decision making under risk , uncertainty , ignorance made , long before ellsberg , tversky kahneman even born , treatise probability 1921 . keynes , not ellsberg , first specify index take into account relative credibility available information base upon which decision maker would base his probability calculations . keynes index specifies weight evidence , , measure completeness relevant information currently potentially available . defined unit interval [ 0 , 1 ] , 0lt ; = wlt ; = 1 . keynes , not ellsberg , first incorporate his variable(ellsberg rho variable)into decision rule which generalized both expected ( monetary)value ( subjective)expected utility rules . instead maximizing emv = pa or seu = pu(a ) , decision maker would maximize ca , where =p (1/[1+q])[2w/(1+w )] . keynes decision rule , not tversky kahneman prospect theory , first provide decision weights , called keynes conventional coefficients weight risk(see above ) , provided explicit numerical solutions certainty , reflection , translation , preference reversal effects . keynes , not i good , koopmans or kyburg , first present mathematically technically sound exposition clearly specified interval(set ) estimate approach probability . finally , keynes weight evidence approach allows one clearly distinguish risk , uncertainty , ignorance . risk case if = 1 . ignorance case if = 0 . uncertainty(or ambiguity)is case if 0lt ; wlt ; 1 . risk then further separated into linear risk nonlinear risk , which requires keynes modified formula , =p /(1+q ) . fact keynes got mountain top first before ellsberg tversky-kahneman not mean forms analysis developed applied ellsberg tversky-kahneman unsound . contrary , made clear this book , they very sound . however , theoretical level , they not original . what original empirical experimental evidence accumulated over 30-40 year period provides confirmation their conclusions , well those keynes	1

quality control handbook classic reference book quality engineers , first released 1951 . among quality management ideas concepts which juran well known include top management involvement , pareto principle , need widespread training quality , definition quality fitness use , project-by-project approach quality improvement . joseph juran belief " quality not happen accident " gave rise quality trilogy namely quality planning , quality improvement quality control . elements quality trilogy summarised follows : quality planning * identify who customers . * determine needs those customers . * translate those needs into our language . * develop product respond those needs . * optimise product features so meet our needs customer needs . quality improvement * develop process which able produce product . * optimise process . quality control * prove process produce product under operating conditions minimal inspection . * transfer process operations . juran revolutionized japanese philosophy quality management significantly helped shape their economy into industrial leader it today . this excellent book highly recommended those involved quality control management .	1

explain technique extracting iptables messages noise /var/log/messages directing them their own log . this question comes up repeatedly iptables mailing list . trick use " -- log-level " switch configure syslog write items come through specified log-level seperate log . you still get occasional false positive this way , but it sure beats slogging through all noise /var/log/messages . i couple criticisms make book . example , start firewall boot time , authors recommend ieither using " iptables save " function ( red hat ) , or adding line rc . local . problem former " iptables save " , authors point out , not terribly reliable . furthermore , if you're using script generate your firewall rules , then your rules already saved . problem rc . local then firewall start after network up services listening . i prefer write init script use chkconfig utility ( red hat/suse ) bring up firewall rules before network . biggest omission book any information bridge firewalls . bridge very useful putting transparent firewall onto your network . i am surprised there not even mention bridging , or ebtables ( userspace bridge tools ) , since bridging now part standard kernel . iptables also made work bridge module . pointing out this omission may not completely fair criticism : i yet see firewall book covers bridging linux ebtables ( or iptables ) . nonetheless , " linux firewalls " very nice addition my library . this book live either my desk , or any easily-accessed shelf nearby . disclosure : publisher sent me copy this book review .	1

set beginning twentieth century , ford madox ford novel " good soldier " story two married couples edward leonora ashburnham john florence dowell . couples meet while wandering europe , after becoming acquaintances , they continue meet every year nauheim germany . ashburnhams leading nomadic life thanks edward scandalous behaviour number women . leonora , beautiful but cold irish-catholic assumed responsibility their financial affairs after edward squanders fortune courtesan . edward , " good soldier " former british army officer . he noble , brave , capable fantastic acts benevolence . when he enters room , his good looks confident bearing " snapped up gaze every woman . " everyone -- except leonora -- admires edward . american couple , dowells wandering around europe thanks florence delicate health . florence ' heart condition ' forbids transatlantic trip , john more or less florence nursemaid . many years after first meeting ashburnhams , narrator john dowell recalls key events their lives . dowell quintessential " unreliable narrator . " he simply unaware his wife true nature , blissfully ignorant passionate events taking place under his nose . so when events come head , he no longer ignore obvious , dowell attempts piece together events took place years before , he asks : " who this world knows anything any other heart -- or his own ? "" good soldier " brilliantly structured novel -- masterpiece character study . dowell function mainly record events he failed interpret correctly time occurrence . he isn't main player here -- rather , he historian who elects ignore what he didn't wish see . yet , time novel ends , dowell possesses great insight understanding all other characters -- leonora , who effectively emasculates her erring husband , edward whose weakness sentimentality ruin him , florence , whose self-righteousness ability deceive reaches astronomically hideous proportions , nancy , ward ashburnhams , whose desire punish edward matches leonora . above all , dowell effectively translates notion great tragedy taken place . leonora edward trapped their marriage their natures . leonora response edward irresponsibility only choice she make , consequently , ashburnhams ' incompatibility endured insufferable silence . many literary critics consider " good soldier " one greatest novels twentieth century -- i think it one most powerful complex novels adultery betrayal i ever read -- displacedhuman	1

carl menger founded austrian school economics 1871 . austrian approach economics characterized three words : subjectivism , methodological individualism disequilibrium . essentially this comes down regarding economic phenomena outcomes rational individual choice - because multitude actors involved interdependency their choices - their pattern one disequilibrium continual adjustment . menger ' principles economics ' primer value theory . value theory foundation economics , because it describes nature economic decisions . classical economists ( smith marx ) claimed labour content key explaining relative prices . basis their argument equivalence value necessary condition exchange therefore - order make comparisons possible - value objects reduced common denominator . according adam smith value object someone effort required obtain it because hour toil just irksome one man it anyone else , ricardo -building adam smith incomplete value theory - claimed labour origin all value labour content its measure . labour seemed unit which all value reduced . next logical step this line thinking appearance invidious marxist fallacy , since labour necessary maintain labour , price labour equivalent labour necessary its reproduction - house , feed clothe it . if 10 hours labour offered daily employer , these 10 hours spent his worker his product should fetch capitalist equivalent 10 hours work spent product market . when only 5 hours his labour time necessary maintain worker , then capitalist " exploits " worker not compensating him full value his work . menger showed valuation goods subjective process . no matter how much labour spent good it wouldn't exchanged any other product unless it able satisfy some need which higher than need satisfied product given exchange . because value subjective exchange goods take place even when their labour content differs . commerce enhances welfare offering goods which relatively little value one party exchange goods which relatively higher value vice versa . commerce therefore not sterile process , but highly productive one .	1

" long day journey into night " wholly depressing read i really could without . however , after learning more eugene o'neill background , extent which play based his life , i began greater appreciation this play . o'neill lead very hard life , therefore frustration despair i felt while reading this play demonstrates o'neill talent engage his audience convey emotions characters very real manner . while o'neill depressing end not satisfy my craving happy ending , it appropriate play eugene own family never got happy ending . i like clever way o'neill showed tyrone family desire but inability forget their troubles through dialogue . beginning play audience presented normal , loving family . audience soon however , gets suspicion something isn't quite right , family tense . slowly family skeletons exposed through arguments family members , but characters always feel regretful bringing subject up . thus showing no matter how hard tyrone family tries pretend all well , their skeletons always them resurface continually remind them truth . although i still believe " long day journey into night " thoroughly disheartening read , reader emotional response this play leaves no doubt o'neill exceptional writing .	-1

" search excellence " interesting book read which international bestseller when it first published 1982 . book written general public simple easy understand language explores art science management used leading companies records long-term profitability continuing innovation . however , information presented not based hard data ( or based faked data ) , which its main weakness . this controversial book widespread impact wall street analysts corporate management its time publication . word excellence appeared many american corporate strategy statements . however , some few years later , significant number companies highlighted this book fine examples excellence , particularly high technology companies including atari , data general , dec , ibm , lanier , ncr , wang , xerox others failed produce excellent results . book " search stupidity merrill chapman " chronicles some fallacies propounded book especially respect high technology companies profiled book . book divided into eight chapters which correspond main themes which peters waterman argued responsible success cited corporations , follows : * bias action : active decision making or getting job . * close customer : learning people served business . * autonomy entrepreneurship : entails nurturing innovation promoting champions . * productivity through people : treating ordinary employees source quality . * hands-on , value-driven : management philosophy guides everyday practice - management showing its commitment . * stick knitting : settle business you know . * simple form , lean staff : some best companies minimal overhead personnel particularly head office . * simultaneous loose-tight properties : giving autonomy shop-floor activities whilst maintaining centralised values . book some interesting features seen themes highlighted above it still worth buying .	-1

" come again ?? physics mathematics behind string theory but who not conducting research it . author demands rightfully scientific theory must testable or least must some amount empirical predictions . he pulls no punches his critique string theory , very open what he thinks motivations behind those who actively involved it . researcher motivations course not germane validity theory he or she proposes , but they relevant understanding why particular theory entrenched scientific community , even though there no experimental evidence it . this reviewer disagrees author his claim string theory not " beautiful " theory . it mathematical formalism used string theory gives it its beauty . indeed , just algebraic geometry alone employed string theory example this . combined differential geometry , complex manifolds , algebraic topology makes string theory beautiful multi-faceted mathematical gem . said , there many ideas string theory deserve classified " speculative " mathematics , author this book . this classification arises because presence ubiquitous path integral , object resisted rigorous mathematical formulation . so yes , mathematical formalism behind string theory beautiful , intoxicates those who contemplate it . but physical theory must more than just " mental masturbation " ( characterization imputed physicist murray gell-mann book ) . it must also make predictions measured laboratory , these measurements must reproducible above all understandable interested parties . author not find any these predictions string theory it exists present time , he correct his claims . those who worked academic setting understand fully negative reaction author received when manuscript circulated review , which he describes some detail book . this criticism course anonymous into social interactions attitudes among string theorists . it would unfair say all string theorists arrogant protective their status academicians . but those meet this characterization position cannot morally justified . discovery scientific truth demands transparency not only because complications theory , but also because those who not directly participating it responsible it financing ( taxpayer ) . string theorists , all scientific mathematical researchers morally obligated report their discoveries those who not their field manner makes it crystal clear what they all . string theory should not collection documents protected interpreted small body privileged priests knowledge .	1

dr. thomas sowell book , " conflict visions " attempt explore primary , if unarticulated , philosophy historical conservatism liberalism . his thesis conservatism tradition operating vision humans sees them ' constrained . ' some characteristics this view :( 1 ) humans generally selfish natures . ( 2 ) human reason , while valuable , quite limited . ( 3 ) because this , society grows evolution , not central deliberate planning . ( 4 ) social decisions generally involve not ' solutions ' but ' trade-offs ' ( how much good how much downside ? )(5 ) procedural fairness , rather than results-based fairness , key just society . conversely , sowell writes liberal tradition operates vision humankind ' unconstrained . ' features include : ( 1)human selfishness quality overcome reason education . ( 2 ) human reason , when used properly , trump human impulses , emotions , feelings . ( 3)the planned society best . non-planned societies = chaos . ( 4 ) while policy trade-offs might good short term solution , reason discover true solutions equitable all . ( 5)procedural fairness not fair so long disperate outcomes result . sowell backs up his thesis impressive research , citations , quotes . this refreshing becuase it makes sure he not simply creating strawmen . conservative side , his quites tend come edmunde burke , adam smith , freidrich hayek , oliver wendell holmes . liberal side , his quotes tend come william godwin , marquis de condorcet , jean jacques rousseau , ronald dworkin . ( one who read all these authors , i assure readers there no strawmen here . ) only murky part book sowell makes this vision sound too simplistic . while he acknowledges not all thinkers fall into either one or other category ( even chapter marx mill - two thinkers borrow both sides ) , some his choices people quotes exempify each ' side ' less clean-cut than one might like . libertarian , it strange me see edmunde burke ( who valued tradition more than most anything ) friedrich hayek ( who valued innovation capitalism more than anything ) same group . ( holmes not necessarily best jurist exemplify ' strict construction ' contitution ) . [ it would interesting see , then , appendix ideological divorce libertarianism conservatism . ] other ' side , ' i kept thinking , although william godwin might good example someone who believed reason virtually omnipotent , he also liability sowell case , godwin not believe planned society whatever fact , anarchist who against planning any form ! while examples aren't perfect , sowell didn't intend them . all all , it good book i think sowell argument good one , most part , true . some other books similar vain - exploring ideological divide sides - try george lakoff " moral politics " e.j. dionne " why americans hate politics . "	-1

) blasting through dante thought without recognizing dante own choices end-stopping his thoughts more frequently . unless english 20 percent more efficient than italian , or translators care sense exclusion original poetics , this book disappoints . it swift , compressed opening even three full lines . three lines -- just three -- dante depict himself spiritually waylaid : further compression simply detracts , it dishonors poem already admirable economy , not just its efficiency but also how it chooses spend each tercet , careful filing each one this step or his journey , or run over into next tercet . pinsky bilingual translation , allowing you just visually register how much more ready he than dante break dante thoughts before end line start dante next phrase or sentence two or three or four syllables left . all enjambment perfectly natural english poetry , maybe even italian , but facing-page presentation dante actual words reveal dante employed rhyme togeth regular ryhthm line-endings generally honor his rhetoric . compression , way , makes most cantos radically shorter than dante own verse . canto after canto 20 30 lines short dante italian , when canto maybe 120 or 130 lines long , translation becomes more like discount version dante than english dante . allen mandelbaum , who translates into blank verse ( unrhymed iambic pentameter ) , offers poem dignity dante italian merits . you use facing page italian see . dope out what those latinate words obviously mean , see how much reordering reduction pinsky offers -- here turning descriptive phrase into single adjective , there shrinking long appositive or subordinate clause . pinsky diction more fluent , more readily grasped than other translations , but it often feels off-hand , hasty , artless , undramatic -- tour hell cargo pants . story still conveys its tone , but mostly through incident , not via pinsky poetry	-1

successfully decimate us pacific fleet december 7 , 1941 . incident unified country , creating fighting force support system home eventually resulted defeat massive evil outside borders usa . given atmosphere over half century ago , author proser created one most convincing portraits military hero literature . intensively researched detailed approach results biography fully restores ambience ww ii . john basilone nice italian boy form raritan , new jersey , lad who quit school follow his recurring visions . he caddied japanese businessmen country club , seeing his prophetic mind some day he would war japan . after trying multiple jobs he finally enlists army , makes best boot camp gambling boxing , shipped philippines where he spent time waiting , boxing ( becoming champion nicknamed manila john ) , running little bar his island sweetheart , finally returning home . frustrated once again boredom work embarrassment not finished his education , basilone finally returns military signing usmc , trains hard quantico , cuba , other us training camp swamps , finally shipped guadalcanal where his brilliance dedication his commanding officer ( " chesty " puller ) through one most devastating battles pacific arena earned him not only respect his men , but also medal honor - highest commendation offered his country . returning home form this mission he ride waves adulation form american people , hobnobs movies stars , sells war bonds , falls love , only shipped out once again pacific where he killed action battle iwo jima . amazing ( , one amazing ) aspect this book proser elected write it first person john basilone . everything told basilone perceives it , lives , feels , survives it . rarely story written such clarity perception : we truly feel basilone written his memoirs . language period exactly right , descriptions various battles conditions soldier under tremendously adverse conditions vivid , soldiers ' mentality thick war written such bulls-eye focus no matter what reader opinion war might , this book makes it all understandable form point view soldiers who fought . some battle passages tough read : " october 23 , light tank infantry attack across mouth matanikau ran right into teeth vandegrift defenses . it chewed up short order over 600 japs killed , many them trapped jungle clearing where us tanks just drove over them instead wasting ammunition . they ground poor bastards up like sausage under tank treads until entire clearing covered gore left rot sun . " but what luck born into family country where one chance reach adulthood , let alone able attend medical school ? quite bit . unlike its predecessor , which looked prodigious accumulators wealth ( paws ) vs . under-accumulators wealth ( uaws ) , this book focuses millionaires ( paws ) decamillionaires ( tiny subset paws , those net worth $10m or greater ) . lack comparison general public serves limit book value . misleading comparison businessmen stockbrokers pp . 76ff makes point . stanley states former occupation more likely higher net worth . but this comparison misleading because he only looking millionaire-plus sample ; he excluding more total business owner population his sample than stockbrokers . average median income net worth business owners likely lower than stockbrokers . if he made same comparison actors or musicians stockbrokers , example , problem more obvious -- excluding all those who aren't worth $1m or more up front , you exclude vast majority , pull up average . stockbrokers , other hand , higher percentage them top income earners wealthy . . 110 , after pages importance ethics advising " never lie . never tell one lie . " ( . 55 ) , he passes right over his example , mr. warren , lying college graduate order get job , without comment , without noticing hypocrisy . pp . 173-174 , author wants make point prayer important millionaires dealing stress , despite fact majority his surveyed population not regularly pray . ( he repeats this again . 370 , saying " nearly one-half millionaires ( 47 percent ) engaged prayer . ... significant percentage millionaires , their religious faith major force their lives . " ) trying emphasize point ( . 174 ) , he splits his sample into " religious millionaires " ( rm ) " other millionaires " ( om ) , observes 75% rm engage prayer while only 8% om , points out this " ratio more than nine one . " this meaningless comparison , however -- rm make up only 37% his total population millionaires , so his " more than nine one " ratio really nothing more than saying , those millionaires who religious , three-fourths hold religious practices which involve regular prayer ( 8% those who not consider themselves religious pray anyway ) . since om population much larger than rm population , absolute numbers that not nine-t o-o ne ratio -- his numbers show 28% his total sample rm who pray , while 5% his total sample om who pray -- closer six-t o-o ne ratio . but more importantly , author glosses over fact not only majority millionaires not religious , even quarter those who don't engage regular prayer ! given u.s. one most religious countries world , fact such low percentage millionaires religious quite interesting worthy further exploration cause , but stanley , religion prayer important foundation " millionaire mind , " he completely misses opportunity find explanation why millionaires so much less religious than general population . later table book . 366 , he shows activities engaged sample 733 millionaires during preceding 30 days . table includes 52% attending religious services , 47% praying , 37% attending religious events , 22% bible/devotional reading . these numbers don't quite match up rm/om data pp . 173-174 , which seem show even lower levels religious activity , but these still lower than they nonmillionaire population -- weekly church attendance notoriously over-reported surveys . work mark chaves , . kirk hardaway , p.l. marler 1990s found actual percentage attendance half what surveys show . this actually could mean millionaires attend more often , if stanley survey results don't similar over-reporting . author religious bias further leads him recommend student going through divorce she , despite not church attendee , search mate joining church group ( . 268 ) because she " believed marriage traditional family concept . " he writes " i believe one likely find better prospects church setting than singles bars . course , there no guarantees , but people religious orientation more prone respect principles espoused good book . " but why he just guessing this ? hasn't he asked his population millionaires -- ones who 63% non-religious -- how they met their mates ? he this , very usefully , regarding how millionaires purchase their homes ( pp . 315-326) -- yet isn't picking partner even more important ? this book some interesting data , its best when giving comparative results populations ( e.g. , house-purchasing characteristics economically productive millionaires vs . non-economically productive millionaires chapter 7 ) . but it doesn't stand up well comparison millionaire next door , which much better book	-1

thought spider thread top her game . some ways thrilling alone , it . but no good deeds even better characterization narrative thrust . this book starts keeps cooking , not wanting let you go . there " so marcel proust character comment " le ? ? de guermantes " , third novel his seven-novel masterpiece " remembrance things past " . orginal french title " la recherche du temps perdu " evidently impossible translate literally , but this english title one preferred translator c.k scott moncrieff . proust himself neurotic or least neurasthenic generally accepted . chronic invalid , he retired world age 35 . living alone asthmatic , he wrote wrote wrote this epic belle epoque , filling it complex contradictory characters . many minor , introduced then never met again , others disappear hundreds pages before suddenly re-appearing . book written first person singular , " la prisonni ? re " proust finally admits narrator christian name marcel . relationships become complicated , occasionally translator point out reader mistakes proust made his cross-referencing . long alphabetical list characters found line , but prenez garde ! list full spoilers . primarily , novels reflect social milieu late 19th century , ending after world war i , endless matin ? es , th ? , soir ? es figured so importantly existence indolent class . ( it assumed narrator independently wealthy : " albertine disparue " he casually mentions ordering yacht rolls royce albertine . ) this class season spoiled if one not invited sit duchesse box theatre whole year ruined if one snubbed comtesse afternoon social . proust descibes these atmospheres intense intimate detail , whether it quiet street combray or house ill repute paris . amazingly , narrator remarks " sodome et gomorrhe " : " i not observant mind . " ( hein !? ) it beginning " sodome et gomorrhe " narrator becomes morbidly preoccupied homoerotic elements french monde demimonde . after he begins chasing elusive albertine , he suspects she sapphic torments himself she herself chasing other girls . ( his long courtship albertine reflects swann courting demimondaine odette earlier " du ? ? de chez swann " . gilberte , daughter swann odette , narrator childhood petite amie ; she herself marries narrator -- well , yes , it become labyrinthine . ) long story most memorable most mysterious character baron de charlus , it his sudden assignation tailor jupien alerts narrator parisian nether world . charlus becomes involved handsome young violinist charles morel , sexual id ? fixe , even novel most macho character . all this distresses narrator exceedingly ( one begins suspect he doth protest too much ) he takes moralistic tone . however , it narrator who , " albertine disparue " , picks up little girl off street takes her home , indiscretion which earns him visit ? ret ?. charlus , he goes one odette early " sponsors " willingly whipped mercenary stable boys . these changes would strain imagination except they happen over hundreds pages ; , course , proust strong sense psychological development , it major character like albertine or minor character like aim ?, headwaiter balbec , who serves table parisian restaurant " modest brilliance " , causing argument saint-loup his mistress . throughout quiet turmoil these various stories , reader fascinated . he turns page after unindented page , nothing much happens , yet he keeps reading . admirers somerset maugham realize here i'm paraphrasing maugham remarks jane austen his great essay " pride prejudice " , there surprising resemblance austen proust . would i read " remembrance things past " again ? not way i this time , but i enjoy re-reading sections here there , dinner verdurins or narrator visit venice . lo que en el lejano 1997 comenz siendo un entretenimiento , un osado intento de que los nios adolescentes espaoles se aficionaran la lectura conocieran un poco de esa historia que haba desaparecido de los libros de texto , se ha convertido , al cabo del tiempo , en la mejor serie de novela histrica en castellano desde los episodios nacionales de galdos , en el plano internacional , el mas vivido pico retrato de una poca desde la triloga de los mosqueteros de alexandre dumas . igual que , despus de dumas , ya no fuimos capaces de ver al cardenal richelieu sino como al maquiavlico villano en la sombra , tras prez reverte al gran quevedo no lo podremos imaginar sin la espada desenvainada el " no queda sino batirse " . en eso consiste el genio de la novela histrica : en ser veraz , ser puntilloso en descripciones lenguaje adems dar vida esos datos fros que llenan las biografas en las enciclopedias . dar vida los personajes histricos no consiste en coger un faran , un emperador romano o lo que sea ponerlo descifrar enigmas policacos . consiste en tomar personajes reales , con sus virtudes defectos , hacerlos actuar segn las propias reglas de su tiempo su carcter . el gran arturo , tras mostrarnos en las otras novelas de la saga las mazmorras de la inquisicin , las trincheras de flandes el puerto de sevilla , nos lleva esta vez al teatro . teatro con maysculas porque nunca antes desde luego nunca despus , conocera la historia tal concentracin de genios dedicados escribir para un publico que converta cada estreno en un acontecimiento social . ah estaba el capitn alatriste , codendose con los poetas , encamndose con las actrices como no , salvando el pescuezo al mismsimo rey de las espaas . vuelven el cruel villano malatesta angelica de alquezar , ese bollicao mezcla de lolita femme fatale . como no , all esta tambin iigo de balboa para contarnos como ocurri todo . finalmente , como es habitual en perez reverte no faltan los " cameos " de algunos personajes actuales que el lector espaol ( no as los ajenos la realidad espaola ) no tardara en reconocer . en cuanto al titulo , aquellos que no sigan la trayectoria de p-r posiblemente no adviertan el guio sentimental que esconde . " el caballero del jubn amarillo " es , segn dice p-r en el prologo de su primera novela " el husar " , el titulo de un folletn que el propio padre de arturo perez reverte escribi hace tiempo , cuando el folletin era ya un genero muerto muchos crean que enterrado . posiblemente el padre de p-r nunca imagino que su propio hijo desenterrara el genero lo elevara cumbres no antes holladas . en resumen : un nuevo acierto del mejor escritor espaol vivo .	1

i.e. when sp goes down -5% , you still get 1% return , when it goes up 5% you get 5% , when it goes up 20% you capped 17% . although i found out these eiul around only last five years or so , back-testing this approach 50 years yields some 9.4% , it makes sense you getting upside sp investment without downside risk , thus it bit lower than historical 50-year sp return . this reviewer thinks ' hidden costs ' properly constructed eiul , 1% ( average over 20-year span ) very reasonable , pay both administration well insurance component , but it tax implications ( grow tax-deferred withdrawn tax-free ) seems too good true . i haven't started eiul policy yet , but am seriously considering it , everything i've able find not able refuted many confuse equity indexed universal life properly constructed implemented ( following tax rules/laws ) other vehicles similar but not offer kinds growth advantage nor cost advantage this . while it may seem extreme no longer fund 401(k ) its maximum limit purchase universal life insurance contract instead , tax perspective there seems compelling case here . least i convinced ( after paying mortgage off early age 39 my case ) money could put better use elsewhere	1

' doubting disease ' arguably most important book ever written this terrible affliction . christian whose life , over last 30 years , scarred obsessive-compulsive disorder ( ocd)/scrupulosity , i know . book helped me enormously . age 13 , i began show symptoms ocd : typical counting , tapping , walking back-and-forth rituals beginning become distracting noticeable ( yes , i repeated bouts strep throat child . ) then , 15 , my parents , who intentionally raised me without any religious training , semi-unwittingly sent me summer camp maine happened christian fundamentalist . over 2 months there , i took part daily bible study , heard many fire-and-brimstone sermons constantly encouraged convert camp counselors who all born-again christians . timing this experience my pre-existing ocd couldn't worse - my intense fears salvation , hellfire belief god , now fully enflamed camp ( occasional fundamentalist preacher shortwave radio ) combined biochemical disorder going my brain . resulting mixture so volatile i am still recovering this day . age 16 , i literally jumping off wall . caught throes full-blown ocd rituals colored unfounded religious notions , i tormented throughout my high school years . numerous times each evening during dinner , i would get up compulsively jump touch ceiling attempt " catch " blasphemous thought reaching heaven . within year ceiling our kitchen literally blackened my fingerprints . height my suffering this disease , my scrupulous obsessions so fearful corresponding compulsions so persuasive i once moved fall my knees middle crowded high school corridor front all my friends order achieve forgiveness some unacceptable thought . my parents beside themselves worry thought i might schizophrenic . i shuttled neurologist , family therapist other " professionals " , none whom slightest inkling what going . this , unfortunately , late-70s , ten years before world would learn this insidious disease . it wasn't until 1989 daniel goleman wonderful article ' new york times ' judith rapoport ' boy who couldn't stop washing ' i discovered cause my suffering over previous 14 years . cardio-nervous breakdown age 19 ( i unfortunate distinction suffering real , physical cardiac irritation when i am engaged mental compulsions ) years self-therapy writing cured me worst obsessions compulsions , but i still suffering . i began seek psychiatric help age 30 , after costly 2 year delay caused irresponsible warnings church scientology ( during which i deteriorated into period anxiety , panic attacks frequent trips emergency room my cardiologist ) , i finally 20 mg prozac daily . this thankfully resulted further improvement , especially anxiety panic attacks becoming disabling interfering my developing career executive international telecommunications industry . however , mental demons form persistent religious ruminations , obsessions painful , time-wasting compulsions continued plague me . fear committing unforgivable sin ( book matthew ) accidentally selling my soul devil recurring themes occupying my mind years years . it only through behavioral exposure response prevention ( erp ) strategies presented mr. ciarrocchi this book , i able achieve some degree normalcy freedom shackles ocd/scrupulosity . i strongly recommend this book anyone who needlessly suffering doubting disease	1

luigi pirandello 1921 play " six characters search author " ( " sei personaggi cerca d'autore " ) deserved reputation first existentialist drama profound effect later playwrights , especially those practitioners theater absurd such samuel beckett ( " waiting godot " ) , eugene ionesco ( " rhinoceros " ) , jean genet ( " maids " ) . pirandello writing often focuses elements madness , illusion isolation , all which inspired tragic aspects his personal life which his wife went insane his daugther tried commit suicide . 1921 during five week period pirandello wrote his two acknowledged masterpieces , " six characters search author " " henry iv . " while " six characters " successful when it opened rome it also considered scandalous . however , it soon performed milan , london , new york , germany . because his great influence modern theater , pirandello awareded noble prize literature 1934 . two years later , while negotiations appear film version " six characters , " he died . setting " six characters search author " rehearsal play ( pirandello ) interrupted arrival six characters . their leader , father , tells manager they looking author . it seems author who created them never finished their story they unrealized characters who not yet fully brought life . father insists they not real people but characters , manager his cast only laugh idea . but then they become intrigued bits pieces story six characters tell . father intellectual who married mother , peasant woman . however , she fell love his male secretary father , bored his wife , encouraged her leave . she , leaving behind eldest son who embittered abandonment . mother three children this other man but then father starts miss her watches other children grow up . this new family moves away , but after other man dies mother her children return city . mother gets job madame pace dress shop , but it turns out brothel where step-daughter ends up employed . one day father shows up set up step-daughter . however , mother stops them reaching obvious conclusion entire family moves father resentful son . manager agrees produce their story become author whom they searching . he tries stage scene where father meets step-daughter dress shop but both characters insist what actors doing not realistic . manager allows them finish out scene instead . this sets up basic juxtaposition " drama " " reality " rest play , key scenes lives these characters providing more questions than they answer what happened what it means . point when manager no longer tell difference acting reality he becomes fed up entire thing ends rehearsal , providing audience already challenged these changing notions reality abrupt ending drama . almost all characters play known their roles rather than their names , such leading man second female lead . one few characters drama who name madame pace , who charge dress shop also serves brothel where step-daughter works . it perhaps this formality serves distance us production more than strangeness action or aged words , even though they adapted modern ear . there may or may not real story here , but ultimate point this play tradition reality theater no longer holds true . radical idea here there immutability reality these six characters . because they forms , forced into performing actions which they imagined , there inherent conflict life . this why son wants escape but cannot leave studio must play his role , must mother rest characters . this just true all other characters besides six , although others less inclined see truth , or least reality , their own situation until end , when final scene drama seeks dissolve " stage " reality completely . where pirandello succeeds end it both ways , we interpret what we seen reality or acting . either way , you left same conclusion .	1

several reviewers submitted highest life aristotle proposes consists " hard work " or " most difficult life . " i am afraid this language not accurately present aristotle description . aristotle writes these lecture notes contemplative life " superior human level " ( 1177b27 ) . yet , he distinguishes it secondary lives saying these secondary lives " require trouble " ( 1177b18 ) . aristotle calls contemplative life most pleasant life ( 1177a25ff ) . certainly , study hard work ; but this not hard work sense toil . work towards truth contemplate it once attained requires little strain . it virtuous agent right action any given circumstance : ease . through influence kant ( possibly stoics ) , we often associate virtue denying passions overcoming greatest obstacles ; likewise , we associate vice passions overcoming reason . this sense , most virtuous person would no passions all . however , aristotle suggests passions only conflict reason lower moral character . when reason prevails one right action against passion urges , he calls this ' enkrasia ' ; when passions overcome , he calls this ' akrasia ' . however , internal discord present these characters not present virtuous ( vicious ) . virtuous character most reliable participates definition virtue itself because agent habituated passions follow reason . his or her passions actually encourage agent what right . ( note : vicious agent , through doing base actions , no longer recognizes them such , so reason passion coincide doing what wrong ) . applying these distinctions contemplative life , we see this activity not work all sense toil . activity requires effort sure ; but , this effort most enjoyable agent . it engages what highest human person when it carried out through ( morally intellectually ) virtuous character , this activity turns out most pleasurable . so while pleasure not human good not measure happiness , it wrong think good life not pleasant eudaimon . it only stuggle those still way achieving it	1

why three most powerful forces our world -- evolution , democracy capitalism -- so controversial ? hundreds ( case democracy , thousands ) years after they first understood , we still can't quite believe these three phenomena work . socialist europe resists capitalism , religious right america questions evolution middle east makes mockery democracy . when you think it , it easy understand why : all three radically counterintuitive . " one person , one vote ? " what if they vote wrong ? but that problem--we're thinking it . our brains aren't wired understand wisdom crowd . evolution , democracy capitalism don't work anecdotal level personal experience , level which our story-driven synapses built engage . instead , they're statistical , operating realm collective probability . they're not right--they're " righter " . they're not predictable controllable--they're inherently out control . that scary unsettling , but also hugely important understand world increasing complexity diminishing institutional power ( mainstream media : meet blogs ; military : meet insurgency ) . fortunately , this book makes sense all this . out control first published 1994 , well before its time , but it one those rare books sells better each year it gets older . that because kelly recognized messy markets natural selection , enlightened self-interest invisible hands all anticipated internet delights watching peer-to-peer cacophony create greatest oracle world ever seen . some examples may bit dated dozen years later , but message only become more true : " there no central keeper knowledge network , only curators particular views , " he writes . emergent mob wisdom blogosphere wikipedia unimaginable then , but somehow kelly imagined them all same . this may smartest book past decade	1

relatively few pages devoted narration actual combat . much story preparation army dealt sometimes stormy relationships president mckinley , secretary war alger , commanding general army miles , adjutant general corbin , general shafter , commander cuba , more minor characters . cosmas points out challenges confronting administration which contributed disorganization poor food which it criticized . legal restrictions deployment national guard units complicated recruitment volunteer troops . problems arose out incompatibility equipment among state militias . political tugs war regular state forces complicated staffing . limited ordnance production capabilities constrained material accumulation . shifting war aims introduced inefficiencies into deployment troops . post hostility problems tropical diseases their stateside ramifications receive depth analysis . all all , cosmas concludes war department succeeded , war end , developing suitable army empire . cosmas good job explaining how shifting war aims drove changes invasion plans . whereas original debate centered over attacks havana or puerto rico , discovery adm . cervera fleet santiago harbor compelled landing near santiago . reader learns seemingly irrational departure spanish fleet santiago under orders . resulting destruction spanish fleet cut army off its sources supply condemned it either starvation or surrender . cosmas show how inefficiencies turned up unexpected places . despite longer trip , expedition philippines better organized than one cuba . things turned out , army raised twice many volunteer troops it used . read other books spanish american war , " army empire " supplemented what i already knew . it tied things together showed " whys " behind " whats " . this it worthwhile . i thought extensive verbage supply organization may prove boring , but it never . i would not recommend this first book spanish american war . i recommend it deepen understanding mature reader	1

( 3 ) " flesh devil " african novelist kola boof deeply powerful book examines colorism , but not out open . this book unique it focuses very enchanting love story black prince princess follows their reincarnations through history they struggle find their way back each other . through detailed moments black history , both africa united states , provocative author highlights way black people originally viewed their beauty humanity then juxtuposes it against way they see themselves now modern world . result nothing less than devastating . i love this book so much , because storytelling so rich depth so sweeping grand . anyone who loves good writing proud descended black race find themselves literally changed forever powerful images depicted this very poetically moving story . ( 4 ) " color complex " -- various authors , very simple , straight forward analysis sociological point view . much research statistical facts used illustrate our communities infested these issues . ( 5 ) " darkest child " dolores philips great novel shows us poor blacks who live under poverty line ingesting these complex social hierarchies based color how they not only expose their children them , but force entire community live " color code " . everybody used it slavery system goes unchallenged . this book , tangy mae , darkest 10 children white-looking mother rozelle , struggles find her dignity confidence midst her evil light skinned mother inflicting one horrid abuse top other . one thing i say evil white-looking mother , rozelle , she treated all her children hiddeously contempt , whitest blackest . but she killed child who born looking like tangy mae spoke volumnes . this book very real metaphor what goes . very real .	1

this book , ' critique judgement ' , third volume immanuel kant critique project , which began ' critique pure reason ' continued ' critique practical reason ' . immanuel kant ( 1724-1804 ) considered one giants philosophy , his age or any other . it largely this book provides foundation this assessment . whether one loves kant or hates him ( philosophically , ) , one cannot really ignore him ; even when one isn't directly dealing kantian ideas , chances great kant made impact . kant professor philosophy german city konigsberg , where he spent his entire life career . kant very organised clockwork life - his habits so regular it considered people konigsberg could set their clocks his walks . same regularity part his publication history , until 1770 , when kant ten-year hiatus publishing . this largely because he working this book , ' critique pure reason ' . kant professor philosophy familiar rationalists , such descartes , who founded enlightenment many ways started phenomenon modern philosophy . he also familiar empiricist school ( john locke david hume perhaps best known names this ) , which challenged rationalist framework . leibniz ' monads hume development empiricism its logical ( self-destructive ) conclusion , coupled romantic ideals typified rousseau , philosophical edifice enlightenment seemed topple . this book divided into two major sections , critique aesthetic judgement , critique teleological judgement . part aesthetics , kant sets up possible judgements - agreeable , good , sublime beautiful . this relates back ' critique pure reason ' ( scholar j.h. bernard indicates this framework sometimes bit shackle placed kant ) . those things agreeable wholly sensory character , whereas those things good ethical nature . kant argues those things beautiful sublime fall two poles ' agreeable ' ' good ' . beauty involved purpose ( teleology ) , whereas sublimity which goes beyond comprehension ( object fear ) . this also involves idea mind allows genius creative activity . section teleology , this way looking things based their ends ( telos ) , links aesthetics terms beauty ( which sense finality form ) well links scientific purposes -
