one might not expect naturalist explorer capable weaving dynamic , emotional , gripping narrative par some best fiction writers last century , but that exactly what peter matthiessen accomplished play fields lord . his writing strongly influenced his extensive travels , this , his fourth novel , imbued particular verve . set amazon , tale weaves out untamed jungle , featuring some most compelling conflicted characters i've encountered . martin quarrier , his wife hazel , their son billy left their comfortable midwestern life join protestant missionary leslie huben his wife their ongoing struggle convert elusive local tribe , niaruna . martin respect interest tribal cultures encourages different approach conversion than evangelical leslie , matters quickly become complicated when local authorities ( leslie implicit approval ) enlist aid two american ex-patriot mercenaries bomb tribes into submission . one these lewis moon , half chayenne indian dark past who , under influences powerful psychotrope ayahuasca , eventually decides join niaruna reclaim something his lost dignity sense identity . ultimately , niaruna caught amongst protestant missionaries , catholic " opposition , " local authorities , partial-converts other tribes ; it essentially conflict no one win . narrative weaves martin moon perspectives , each comes grips their own inner conflicts faith identity . matthiessen breathes further life into this story colorful , very real cast supporting characters . ex-patriot mercenary wolf , self-described " anti-se-mite jew " former compatriot disappeared moon provides occasional black humor . matthiessen portrays hazel gradual disintegration frightening realism , building books cumulative tension effectively . leslie huben , his evangelical fervor golden boy demeanor , becomes unexpected antagonist martin struggles his own faith . matthiessen treatment niaruna other brazilian cultures realistic sympathetic without pandering or idealistic , where aboriginals portrayed niether heathens or noble savages . he approaches questions faith , culture , morality , family , spirituality understated ability without becoming mired existentialism . his narrative simultaneously raw elegantly constructed , both exotic intimate read . play fields lord isn't mere travel fiction ; it complex character study suspenseful , driven plot , thought-provoking examination mission work . matthiessen scrutinizes evangelical christianity through very sharp lens , faith individual missionaries remains complex fascinating even non-believer . novel perspective christianity critical one , but personalized through actions individuals without universally condemning . writing comfortable easily digested , while still evoking complex themes moods make this novel so successful . oppresive atmosphere , sense fear uncertainty , primeval jungle ; all richly evoked these pages . it heartbreaking , rewarding , thought-provoking , ultimately haunting read . ~ jacquelyn gil	1

political , natural , social etc . ) which led settling area . griffin treated special interest , its early beginnings military outpost , its heyday outfitting entertainment capital buffalo hunters proves . highly recommended	1
pol pot ruler khmer rouge prime minister cambodia 1976 1979 . he de facto leader since mid-1970s . during his time power pol pot together his cronoies created aggressive regime agricultural reform . society rife paranoia . society designed create utopian communist society which known repressing intellectuals . pol pot espoused radically revised variant maoism , adapted khmer nationalism . envisaging perfectly egalitarian agrarianism , khmer rouge favored completely agrarian society point all modern technological contrivances banned . money made illegal . pol pot rabidly anti-soviet red china considered him balancing force against their archenemies , vietnamese moscow-oriented regime . during detante , western powers took more or less same line , offering diplomatic support khmer rouge after they ousted power vietnamese 1979 . killing fields less important than domino theory . this first book i read major actors vietnam conflict my perspective conflict changed . clearly , viet cong played more aggressive nefarious role emergence khmer rouges than they willing admit . pol pot interesting person , say least . he clearly intellectual , demagogue ideologue . he excellent administration skills must person skilled tactful negotiations his friends who soon became his enemies . really interesting person emerging reading this book not pol pot but king sihanouk , buddy mao kim il song . what king would buddy two worlds worst communist mass-murders ? sihanouk continued efforts lead his land go hand hand pol pot efforts create perfect society . i am not saying sihanouk guilty or contributed killing fields , but he definitely catalyst . all perfect societies , they bound implode . violent inherently evil rule khmer rouge low point world history . it shocking pol pot eliminated larger proportion population known beasts stalin , hitler , or mao . book engaging style ; it read good spy novel not biography ! read it learn	1

like alison lurie first novel , " love friendship " , her second deals marital disharmony among members america academic community . whereas earlier book , however , set wintry new england , " nowhere city " takes place sunny california . paul cattleman , young university historian , accepts job big corporation based los angeles write company history . one major themes book cultural differences america east west coasts . paul his wife katherine both easterners , she upper-class new england family . first they react their change scene very different ways . paul loves los angeles its sunny climate its relaxed lifestyle . katherine , other hand , hates city . this partly because atmospheric pollution aggravates her allergies , but mostly because she regards it cultural wasteland , " nowhere city " book title . los angeles , her , appears no sense history , place living " eternal dizzying present " , where differences seasons , even day night , less distinct than they north-east . differences couple create tensions within their marriage . paul begins affair young waitress named ceci gets drawn into her circle unconventional friends living venice beach , time centre beatnik community . ( book set early sixties ) . this leads into theme book , way which california became americans second half twentieth century what america general europeans earlier generations- frontier , place refuge those dissatisfied one reason or life home seeking better life elsewhere . los angeles area therefore natural magnet beatnik hippie movements . ( this idea california " last resort " also theme eagles ' song name ; it interesting lurie later borrowed title one her own novels , although book set florida rather than california ) . katherine , seeking something which occupy herself , finds work secretary university california , where she too begins affair her boss , academic psychiatrist who estranged husband glamorous hollywood starlet named glory green . this leads complex emotional entanglement . paul affair ceci comes end ; she knows full well he married , but cannot accept idea he still sexual relations his wife . paul then seduced glory , who seeking revenge against her husband . eventually , paul finds himself falling out love california lifestyle , especially after company refuse publish his history which shows them too harsh light , decides move back east take up teaching job prestigious new england college , decision which provokes ironic role-reversal book ending . i can't agree earlier reviewer who said you begin book hating katherine sympathizing paul . my sympathies katherine throughout . paul selfish character who always put his own needs before those his wife ; he bullies her into moving california , ceci no means his first extra-marital affair . it seemed me book written subtly feminist viewpoint interpreted story how katherine learns stand up , say no , her self-centred husband . normal lurie work , tone book , despite some serious themes , relatively light , plenty satirical humour aimed characters ' pretensions . big nutting corporation like social kudos harvard-educated historian their payroll , but not like it when he tells them some truths they not want hear . dr einsam psychiatrist so busy analysing life he unable experience it . glory film industry types who surround her shown up shallow , vain insincere . ( satire hollywood sixties reminded me joan didion " play it it lays " , although book darker more serious tone ) . beatniks childish , more economically dependent than they like think " square " society they despise . although they see society intolerant narrow-minded , same could said their own system values its " them us " mentality . times i found some this satire somewhat unfair . beatnik hippie movements may their hypocritical side , but least their unconventionality idealism force middle america ask itself some difficult questions it might preferred avoid . there really no unpretentious or sincere people working entertainment industry ? nevertheless , satirist role not fair-minded ; satire strains see both sides every question nails its colours firmly fence hardly worthy name . theme cultural differences east coast west coast america perhaps less interesting me , englishman , than it would american readership . ( it always struck me , anyway , two coasts more common each other than either america interior heartland ) . although this not my favourite alison lurie book ( i prefer some her later books such " real people " " truth lorin jones " which greater depth insight ) , " nowhere city " certainly enjoyable read	1

epic tale combining mystery fantasy , treason more than meets expectations--i'd even go so far say it one card best . although storylines completely different , card visits moral dilemmas familiar readers ender series : genocide acceptable tradeoff salvation entire planet ? sacrifice one individual justifiable greater good entire race ? ender game , card creates cold oppressive cage known battle school confine young ender . treason , card creates lush diverse world his protagonist lanik mueller explore his exile . whereas ender growth largely internal self-driven , mueller picks up extraordinary powers while walking earth , meeting new people learning new skills . lanik frequently forced ask himself deeper questions life , sacrifice , identity , all while understanding more he learns , more complex difficult his choices become . he starts novel alone freak ; saving his own skin almost more than he manage . he ends novel terrible powers responsibility comes them , forced choose best way save planet hurtling towards destruction death . unlike ender , he fully aware choice he must make , making his decision all more anguishing tragic . card takes many risks creating fantastic world reader must simply accept -- this tale belongs more realm fantasy than pure " science " fiction . yet risk pays off , making reading experience all more memorable . reader drawn nature protagonist grotesque transformation beauty world stretches imagination . mystery intrigue surrounding planet sudden power shifts keeps plot moving nicely , card creates strong believable cast characters breathe life into story , giving it center soul . finally , card leaves reader ponder lanik decision face nearly impossible choice , world characterized not black white but subtle shades grey . treason probably never garner attention ender game , but nevertheless it excellent thought-provoking story . this book hidden gem canon modern sf fantasy literature reward reader who takes time unearth it	1

robert olwell investigates relationship slaves their masters , beginning stono rebellion 1740 concluding after revolutionary war . rebellion consisted several slaves leading proposed march south carolina spanish florida , pillaging plantations their way gathering slave recruits . they barely begun when slaveholders formed militia crushed insurgents . throughout fifty years following stono rebellion , slaveholders found it their best interests points view finances sanity give slaves certain degree respect . slaves usually least one day off , grew their own produce , generally not sold separate their families , so . furthermore , slaveholders discovered during minor battles prior revolutionary war against indians , france , great britain , slaves would side their masters keep slave family together . sense , then , partnership developed , dissimilar but aligned goals . within , however , both sides sought maximize their own agenda whenever possible . over course his book , olwell gives examples terms justice , religion , marketplace , war . slaves could not expect much justice criminal proceedings against them . if they accused crime , especially against white person , punishment often death , little or no inquiry their guilt . if slaves showed genuine remorse their act ( again , regardless whether or not they actually it ) , their act not especially severe , courts frequently lenient . consequently , slaves quickly learned repentant if they accused crime . regarding religion , slaveholders would liked convert their slaves christianity , but story moses leading god people out egypt suggests , many christian lessons contradicted colonial practice . therefore , they tried involve slaves church , but kept them largely ignorant . missionaries tight leash , often only able stay year . few slaves actually converted , one point around five percent , these their owners handpicked . those converted frequently so not religious reasons , but rather gain favor their owner thereby achieve higher quality life . one area which slaves actually gained advantage over whites marketplace . they allowed sell goods they made , produce they grown , , if their masters no need them day , themselves . this fashion , they manipulated market achieve kind equality ; if whites refused pay price they asked , they refused sell . this especially true latter example , selling day-labor , demand quite high . slaveholders often tried get cut sales , went great lengths get it , but slaves proved adept not paying . throughout all these proceedings , however , masters viewed their plantations their slaves much like king england viewed england his subjects . olwell demonstrates inherent contradiction lies analogy ; england no point history slaves , consequently differed considerably colony forced create laws policies aimed protecting slavery . sense , revolutionary war inevitable . during revolutionary war , many slaves cast their lot england , believing victory side " it certainly not feel-good book , but it well-written memorable page-turner	1
case " sky walking , " dr. thomas . jones , answer resounding " yes . " this book stands head shoulders above many other works former astronauts terms its story , style substance . immensely readable presented just right level detail , " sky walking " chronicles dr. jones ' spaceflight career , which spanned more than decade included four space shuttle flights . his description sights , sounds sensations his first launch aboard endeavour april 1994 mission sts-59 , which he mission specialist first space radar laboratory flight ( srl-1 ) , best i've ever read . he payload commander srl-2 mission ( sts-68 ) october 1994 , later flew two additional shuttle missions . sts-80 , addition setting shuttle endurance record 18 days orbit , involved satellite deployment retrieval . sts-98 , february 2001 , delivered installed destiny laboratory module international space station ( iss ) , mission which dr. jones made three spacewalks lasting more than 19 hours . " sky walking , " dr. jones describes all his missions detail , terms both " space geeks " casual readers find interesting informative . his narrative style refreshingly friendly accessible without simplistic . one thing i particularly noticed his skill covering highly technical issues related space shuttle -- most complicated machine ever built . example , he describes problem space shuttle main engine turbopump rotor tip seals such way casual reader understand issue , yet he supplies enough " meat " satisfy more technically inclined reader . he excellent job " balancing act " finding just right level " nasa-speak " entertain wide audience . highly recommended	1

intensified criminal behavior . injustices within current prison system , including institutionalized racism , gender inequalities , class segregation thoroughly explored this book . she also debates whether prison reform would enough or prison abolition necessary . this book great piece literature exposes readers little no knowledge prisons some cruel realities . book offers overview history prisons . davis takes example california , state which " landscape thoroughly prisonized over last twenty years " ( davis , 12 ) . this overview extremely important underline davis ' point prisons become ineffective rehabilitatory institutions . although , theoretically , main purpose prison rehabilitate criminals , economic factors well racist motives , quickly drove prison system emulate new way slavery . davis says : " segregation ruled south until it outlawed century after abolition slavery . many people who lived under jim crow could not envision legal system defined racial equality " ( davis , 23 ) . need cheap labor south incited spur legislations promoted incarceration many african americans possible after civil war . these prisoners , then , leased out resulting productive yet cheap laborers . davis touches base racism economic oppression issues chapter two her book . evidence help us understand causes which prisons started proliferate when official studies showed crime rate going down ( davis , 85 ) , professor davis uses fact " many corporations global markets , now rely prisons important source profit " ( davis , 85 ) . all data compiled chapter five davis ' book important explain how prison system embodied prison industrial complex manipulates inmates ' labor exchange economic gain . she attributes so-called " tough crime " legislation private prisons other corporations ' interests . although chapter five bombards reader communist idealism , communist mentality not necessary understand davis ' conclusions . even though not enough facts statistics given book regards problem system , book offers two chapters full first hand information gathered davis . nevertheless , book emphasis proposing prison abolition program should go hand hand prison reform movement ( davis , 9-10 ) . she voice many prison reformers who trying end violence sexual abuse prisons , provide prisoners education so their civil rights not stripped away , most importantly , work prisons part solution not cause problem . her last chapter , professor davis proposes , not so concrete ideas adopt completely different system or correction . this book weakest chapter since it too rhetorical lacks solid proposals . she implies amount knowledge work necessary make solid change fact not very achievable saying : " abolitionist approach seeks answer questions such these would require us imagine constellation alternative strategies institutions " ( davis107 ) , referring questions such " how we imagine society which punishment not based race class ? they not fully conscious ? today we close developing sighted machines , which process navigate three-dimensional environments using lasers or stereoscopic video cameras ( e.g. , darpa challenge ) . these machines therefore approaching consciousness ? this seems patently absurd . book whole reeks lack erudition beyond narrow scientific training . we treated freshman physiology lessons neurons , brain areas basic visual processing , details which both not deep enough real scientific comprehension far more detailed than necessary advancing concepts discussed . times , it reads like undergraduate report which student eager impress not let single fact they uncovered go unreported - no matter if they actually enlighten stated aims or not . sum , most problems this book could fixed single simple but profound change : change title " primer vertebrate visual physiology " , circa 1995 . it probably would not sold many copies way , though .	1

' fence , ' example , " rabble all vagabonds hungry men wandering children looking place play " stand outside gates newly constructed " stone house lake front " built wealthy man , who , poet infers , nothing but immoral , amoral , or corrupt . author usher-esque vision , nothing able pass through gates property except " death rain tomorrow . " tomorrow , such corrupt individual or family , inevitably bring nothing but waves bad conscience fevered isolation . ' soiled dove ' examines life woman who " not harlot until she married corporation lawyer , " but who automatically becomes one acquiescing such marriage , who soon discovers her husband also loves " six other women , " if marital infidelity limited exclusively upper economic classes . contrast , ' happiness ' confidently represented " crowd hungarians under trees their women children keg beer accordion , " image which may seem simultaneously nave , patronizing , condescending many readers . occasionally , sandburg wisely acknowledges some portion tragedies man existence simply inherent natural human life cycle . " hand god " also comes blame several poems . chicago poems most effective when sandburg bypasses social divisionalism -- he often his later volumes poetry -- simply addresses everyman individual . while these poems often infused lyrical tender sentimentality slightly reminiscent james whitcomb riley , they also locate acknowledge beautiful within tragedies perpetually arise human frailty , vulnerability , mortality . ' dream dusk , ' author warns " tears loss broken dreams may find your heart dusk , " while ' under harvest moon ' identifies " death " " gray mocker , [ who ] comes you beautiful friend who remembers . " ' i sang ' describes lover who given up his heart " you moon , " but " only moon remembers , kind me . " other poems more pronounced folk character sandburg later volumes . speaker ' theme yellow ' pumpkin , who celebrates paganistic dance children around him " last day october ... singing ghost songs love harvest moon ... i am jack-o-lantern terrible teeth children know i am fooling . " most recent edition complete poems carl sandburg ( 2003 ) , which contains chicago poems its entirety , 832 pages long , provides its readership full range sandburg original often gloriously rich sensual vision life . it also contains works like ' gates tombs , ' slabs sunburnt west ( 1922 ) , which sandburg , " crazy wild dreamer , " more fully maturely developed his political vision . comparatively , reductive , often despairing chicago poems reads like immaturely polarized work it .	1

i am undergraduate neuroscience major . i chose principles neural science my own , because i wanted higher-level text than course required . textbook provides good overview many different aspects neuroscience , synaptic transmission perception development . it easy-to-read , not dense like some textbooks . i find it especially helpful read chapter text before attempting dive into research article . my only criticism it refers material other chapters though it should already learned , though book meant read order not used reference . 63 chapters , i am not sure this appropriate . nevertheless , i highly recommend this text .	1

shane classic tale old west fading away through eyes bobby , young boy , whose family trying homestead range land ( presumably ) wyoming . based loosely johnson county wars early 1890s , tale centers heroic gunfighter shane , man who trying escape his past settling down homesteaders , working alongside bobby parents . unfortunately , ranch barons , seeing their ranges fenced their way life coming close , refuse compromise seek violence against families . one them coldly shot down notorious gunfighter jack wilson , shane forced , very much against his , return way life he sought so desperately leave . end , shane , wounded , knowing he could never settle down , rides off - metaphor old west dying , so shane , though no one ever knows sure , his figure portrayed classic book through eyes late alan ladd remains immortal - starrets us readers . last scenes movie remain very sad -and very timeless . this movie - unlike pablum nonsense churned out hollyweird these days . i echo comments james drury , this book young readers should want read , it solid literature . finally personal note : even though he " bad " guy wilson movie , i want pay my respects nice man fellow pennsylvanian who i honor meeting before his passing , jack palance . rip , mr. palance , god bless	1
